trend_summary: Built-up area widened yearly, filling inner vacant plots and pushing east through land reclamation. New housing, light industry and roads tightened the fabric, while forests and wetlands retreated. Parks and water features appeared but could not offset lost green cover. The landscape evolved from semi-rural edges to a continuous, medium-density suburb.
notable_changes: Vacant lots in the central corridor infilled with new residential and light-industrial blocks.
Construction of additional highways and a large interchange on the west side, boosting connectivity.
Reclamation and stabilisation of the eastern shoreline, converting tidal flats into solid ground.
Clearance of southern forest patches to build curvilinear housing estates.
Appearance of landscaped parks and storm-water ponds near the centre, adding recreational space.
